creator: NOS@Utel.no
text:
In a jsp page, one can set the charcter encoding via a page directive.
If this is omitted, jasper produces a default value. So, a header,
charset=8859_1 is sent when a jsp page is processed that dont specifie a
charset. This value is set at the compile time of the JSP.

So, from where does the 8859_1 charset come from? Its no standard, and
REALLY SHOULD read ISO-8859-1 .
Most browser handles/ignore this entry(it should still be fixed) , except 
Konqueror (www.kde.org) which renders pages with this 'charset' completly 
bloated.

creator: justyna.horwat@sun.com
text: The default character encoding has been changed to ISO-8859-1 in Tomcat 4.0.
